intro: Taverniera longisetosa, commonly known as the long-hairy taverniera, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, as well as its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streambanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
